messages.content: a-person-mask-generator is an extension for Automatic1111 and ComfyUI that automatically creates masks for Background/Hair/Body/Face/Clothes in Img2Img using the Multi-class selfie segmentation model by Google.
When was facial landmark mask output support added for ComfyUI in a-person-mask-generator?
Facial landmark mask output support for ComfyUI was added in a-person-mask-generator on 2024-05-26.
How can you install a-person-mask-generator for Automatic1111 Web UI?

To install a-person-mask-generator for Automatic1111 Web UI, open the 'Extensions' tab, then 'Install from URL' tab, enter 'https://github.com/djbielejeski/a-person-mask-generator.git' as the URL, press 'Install', wait 5 seconds, go to 'Installed' tab, check for updates, apply and restart UI, and completely restart A1111 webui.
What is the first step to install a-person-mask-generator for ComfyUI?

The first step to install a-person-mask-generator for ComfyUI is to navigate to your ComfyUI folder, then into the 'custom_nodes' folder in a CMD window and run the command 'git clone https://github.com/djbielejeski/a-person-mask-generator'.
In the ComfyUI example for a person, what is the order of the masks used?
In the ComfyUI example for a person using a-person-mask-generator, the order of the masks used is: 1) Face, 2) Background, 3) Body + Clothes, 4) Hair.
Is there an example workflow provided for using a-person-mask-generator with facial landmarks in ComfyUI?
Yes, there is an example workflow provided for using a-person-mask-generator with facial landmarks in ComfyUI. The workflow is embedded in the readme/ComfyUI-Workflow-FaceLandmarks.png image.
